page.title: 17PONTYPOOL HERITAGE 2
page.content: Iron works were operating in Pontypool because the ore was readily available in the area,coal and timber were here for fuel in the smelting process and a plentiful supply of water.Engineers in this valley were pioneers in iron then steel manufacture.Our Museum has more detailed history of their patents. Tinplating was a development from the iron_rolling industry.Black lacquered tinplate ware highly decorated with scenic and floral pictures became known as Pontypool Japan Ware.The oils and varnishes used to produce the highly polished finish were extracted from coal.The vessels had the ability to withstand heat. Samples are displayed at Pontypool Further Education College,our Museum, and the National Museum,Cardiff.
